div.ab: Serendit is called SarnadibSri Pada or Adam's Peak, Sri Lanka. on Mt Mountain says the Nubian Geogr Geographer all sorts of jacinths are found in a valley Adamas which sculpts other gems, on Mt Spices aromatic. Aloes. Musk. Zibeti. Sugarcanes Cypress. Nux Indica. In streams Beryllus. Fishing.
Several books like those of HerculaneumWG's comparison, not Casiri's. de Ira &c Virtues & Vices. Florilegium &c
Regum ac militiae Ducum Regimen.
div.note: on Anger etc Virtues and Vices. Anthology etc The Rule of Kings and Military Leaders
div.ab: Work of Abm Ben Jahia Alnacsch Abu Isaac vulgo Ben ZarcalliAbraham Ben Jahia Alnacasch Abu Isaac, commonly called Ben Zarcalli. Casiri has 'Alnacasch' rather than WG's 'Alnacsch'. of Corduba has an incredible number of Astron’ Astronomical propositions on taking latitudes. &c &c &c very scientific
De ratione Harmonica On Harmonic Theory&c&c Ahmad Ben Omar Alkarabisi.
Alhassan Ben Alkhathib predicted the Kg of Egypts death if the decensus Saturni in primum geminorum gradum contingeretIf the descent of Saturn happened in the first degree of Gemini but it was false.

Alhassan on eclipses. quadratura parabolae. Geodaesiae principiis. De Harmonia numerica De Lunae motu, De inveniendis Cubi lateribus. De corona circa Lunam. De horologiis horizontalibus. De Clepsydrae usu &c. Algebra. De Speculis parabolicis comburendis &cQuadrature of the Parabola. On Geodetic Principles. On Numerical Harmony. On the Motion of the Moon. On Finding the Sides of a Cube. On the Ring around the Moon. On Horizontal Clocks. On the Use of the Hourglass etc. Algebra. On Parabolic Burning Mirrors. Casiri has 'comburentibus' rather than WG's 'comburendis'.

Giaphare Ben Almoktaphi wrote on Tailed Comets. ao Heg 225 tempAH 225, in the time of Caliph Almotasem a black spot for many days in Suns centre 91 days & Caliph died. But two [drawing: comet] were seen before death of Raschid.

P241 read in Unii.e. Casiri, Bibliotheca, vol. 1, p. 241. Presumably a note that WG did not finish, perhaps relating to 'lecti in Toletano Collegio' (read at the College of Toledo), if WG was initially going to translate this as 'University'.
Liber primus de febrium differentiisFirst book on the differences in fevers
The 2d Book of this read & written in the College of Toledo. ao Heg 333. ao Xti. 944AH 333 or 944AD
Galen 6 Books of Medicine written at Granada Heg 646. Xt 1248AH 646 or 1248AD
جالينوس GalenThe Arabic for Galen is within a longer Arabic extract, and is not picked out by Casiri, again showing WG's growing facility in reading the language. many copies translated into Arabic

Albategni wrote Heg. 269. He was Harranita professione Sabaeus (ie) Cultor Stellarum. Astronomical calculations died Heg 317 Xti 929. Works at Granada. Longitudes Universal History &c.From Casiri, Bibliotheca, vol. 1, pp. 343-4. Albategni wrote AH 269. He was from Harran [which Casiri puts in Syria; modern Turkey; formerly Carrhae], a Sabean by profession (i.e.) a worshipper of the stars. [Casiri also explains the word ‘Sabaeus’]. Astronomical calculations died AH 317, 929AD. Works at Granada. Longitudes Universal History etc.
عين زربة Anazarbeus
ديسقوريدوس Dioscorides
medicusphysician حكيمwise person [in Casiri, referring to Dioscorides]
Scriptus est in “excelsa Granata urbe RegiaIt is written in "sublime Granada, the royal city

Poema de testamento de Consanguinitate ejusque gradibus ac de Haereditate et Haerede auctor Abu Mohamad Abdalla Ben Abrahim Granatensis.Poem on will[s], on kinship and its degrees, and on inheritance and heir[s], author Abu Mohamad Abdalla Ben Abrahim of Granada.

Legal Decisions by Abu Isaac Abrahamus Ben Abdelrahman. Praefectus Regiae Curiae Granatensis.Prefect of the Royal Court, of Granada
[Casiri’s ‘Praefectus Regius Curiae’ would be Royal Prefect of the Court] p457

Codex literis Cuphicis exoratus Marochi Heg 944 but the author abu Baker Asemo Alcaisi. Granatae Cancellarius. born in ao Heg 760. died 829. Munus Judicibus oblatum.Codex written [Casiri has ‘exaratus’] in kufic letters [litteris] in Morocco, AH 944 but the author Abu Baker Asemo Alcaisi. Chancellor of Granada. Born in AH 760. Died 829. A gift offered to judges.
Theatrum JudicumTheatre of Judges by Mohamad Ben Abraham Ben Farhun a Lawyer of Granada ao Hegirae 811.AH 811
Several books on Matrimony.
Amantium CertaminaLovers’ Struggles by Ahmad Ben Abrahim Ben Mohamad a Syrian who lived at Granada ao Hegirae 812.AH 812
Codex lit Cuph exaratus Granatae
Averrois tractatus de SacrificiisCodex written in kufic letters at Granada Averroes’s treatise on Sacrifices or Animals for Sacrifice or Victuals according to MahomnMahometan (i.e. Islamic) law.
